Name: Funerary Stela of Isidora
Description: The painted funerary stela, an upright stone with a sculpted surface, of Isidora the Cyrenean was damaged and is now restored. It depicts a woman sitting on a chair, resting her feet on a stool, and holding her baby on her lap. Looking kindly at her, the baby raises its hand toward its mother. The two-line inscription in Greek identifies her as a Greek woman who settled in Alexandria. The blue color is used for the acroteria, or small pedestal for statues or other ornaments, and for part of the chair. The pediment, or triangular space, and the legs of the chair are colored in red. Brown and cream are used for the clothes, dark brown for the hair, rose for carnations, and yellow for the footstool.
